phasing_details.phase_detail: Extension of the building on the upper floors to create 2 new residential units. The phase covers the entire development.

description: Erection of a two-storey extension to the existing single storey rear extension to provide 2 x residential units (Use Class C3).
subdivision_of_building: Works to the roof of the single-storey element of the existing building. Rear of the site.
decision_conditions: <p><span id="docs-internal-guid-19e7701a-7fff-7657-b67e-0e19c9ed5ed7"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">By reason of the scale, massing and detailed design of the proposed extension, the proposed development would have an unacceptable impact on the character and appearance of the existing building and the significance of the Hoxton Street Conservation Area. The harm is assessed to be less than substantial to the designated heritage asset which triggers paragraph 215 of the NPPF (2024) requiring the harm to be weighed against the public benefits of the proposals. In this instance there are minor public benefits as a result of the proposed development, however, these benefits are not considered to outweigh the harm to the conservation area. The proposal would, therefore, conflict with Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies LP1 and LP3 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020)</span></span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-57140252-7fff-1355-7396-056b443a18a5"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">By reason of the proposed second floor external terrace, the proposal would provide direct and uninterrupted views looking back towards openings to the rear of 177 Hoxton Street to the detriment of privacy enjoyed by occupiers of this neighbouring property. The proposed development would, therefore, fail to safeguard neighbouring amenity in accordance with Policy LP2 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020).</span></span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-635db4fe-7fff-d3aa-0314-bf0a486d7816"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The proposed development, by reason of a lack of provision of affordable housing, would fail to adequately contribute towards the provision of mixed and balanced communities and housing needs in the local area. As such, the development would not be consistent with Policies H4 and H5 of the London Plan (2021), Policies LP12 and LP13 of the LP33, and the Hackney </span><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:italic;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">S106 Planning Contributions Supplementary Planning Document (2020)</span><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">.</span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-44ab0df4-7fff-7624-abc4-95abd3167f06"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">In the absence of a Unilateral Undertaking or a Section 106 agreement securing appropriate mitigation by restricting future occupiers of the development from obtaining parking permits within the Controlled Parking Zone the proposed development would likely exacerbate existing parking stress and congestion on the surrounding highway network. The application is, therefore, contrary to Policy LP45 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020) and Policy T6 of the London Plan (2021). </span></span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-2d98b263-7fff-b365-5c27-1d196784032e"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">In the absence of a legal agreement securing the financial contribution towards carbon off-setting has not been submitted or completed, the proposal would therefore fail to secure sufficient energy efficiency measures and/or financial contribution towards carbon offsetting, the proposed development would result in an unacceptable level of carbon dioxide emissions, contrary to Policy LP55 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020).</span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-8b772a8d-7fff-7483-521b-eba5fc31d381"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">By reason of the lack of internal headroom failing to meet the minimum internal space standards in terms of ceiling height, the proposed development would result in the provision of substandard accommodation. The proposed development would, therefore, fail to provide high quality accommodation and, thus, would be contrary to Policy D6 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy LP17 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020).</span></span></p>

<p>Insufficient information has been submitted in regard to the refuse and recycling arrangements to alleviate the Council's concern the development would have insufficient and inadequate waste and refuse provision, resulting in adverse litter, odour and pollution impacts, contrary to Local Plan 2033 policies LP57 (Waste) and LP58 (Improving the Environment - Pollution).</p><div><br></div>
